Row.Q: Replaced by 194 Medium Stone Grey starting in 2003.
Was rarely used after 2003. Largely replaced by 226 Cool Yellow around 2004.
Possibly Fabuland Brown (chair, table, etc.). Does the old Duplo horse come in this color?
Used in LegoLand parks long before in sets
Replaced 17 Rose in 1997. Replaced by 222 Light Purple around 2004.
Possibly Fabuland Red (early rust, e.g. duplo cow)
Possibly Fabuland Lime (Fab. Crocodiles, early duplo lime parts)
Often listed as "Light Pink" on BL. Replaced by 9 Light Reddish Violet in 1997.
Replaced by 192 Reddish Brown starting in 2003.
Replaced by 199 Dark Stone Grey starting in 2003.

Striped cat, Eeyore, several LegoLand-only bricks and plates.

Replaced by 208 Light Stone Grey in 2004.
Replaced by 191 Flame Yellowish Orange starting in 2004.

All Yellow Clikits parts. Extremely close to Bright Yellow.

Row.Q: Really 21 Bright Red in softer plastics
Peeron says it's a Clikits color, but also lists other Bright Light Blue parts. Peeron says BL's BLB is Peeron's LtRoyalBlue. Confusing.
Possibly a duplicate for 222 Light Purple and/or 295 Flamingo Pink.
Modern bricks look a bit oranger.
IR covering (e.g. RCX or old Mindstorms Transmitter?)
Clikits, looks very similar to Tr. Fl. Blue. http://brickset.com/parts/colour-Tr-L-Royal-Blue
Old C-3PO minifig color. Replaced in 2006 by 297 Warm Gold.
Copper Mask of Victory. N. American version (left in photo) is more translucent than Euro version.
Replaced in 2006 by 297 Warm Gold. Part 47460 (among others)
Replaced 189 Reddish Gold, 127 Gold, and 147 Sand Yellow Metallic in 2006. Reformulated in 2010, to be more consistent. As a result, the modern color is noticeably darker.
Possibly Clikits pearl-coated ring? Not a real color, in any case.
Not including metal elements (such as axles from the 60s)
There are at least two distinct variants.
Not counting actual metal parts (4.5V plugs, train axles, etc.) Some parts in this color existed as far back as 1998, but it was not given its own official color ID until 2005.
